quote: Captain's log, stardate 41235.25.   Our location planet Ligon II,   source of a rare vaccine needed   on Federation planet Styris IV.   Starfleet has instructed me...
... to engage in a friendly visit   and open treaty negotiations to   acquire this medicinal substance.
Standard orbit, sir.
Lieutenant Yar is calling from   Cargo Bay One, sir. Standing by   to beam Ligonian welcoming party   aboard.
On our way. You have the helm,   Mister Data.
(continuing; toward     controls)   Cargo One.       Should be an interesting   experience.
Agreed. Not only are they closely   humanoid but their history has   remarkable similarities to ours.
But a highly structured society   and they're exceedingly proud.
They've insisted on using their   own transporter device, sir...
It's their way, Lieutenant. Do   they have our coordinates?
They have, sir. Precisely. And   they're standing by for your   signal.
This is Captain Picard of the   Starfleet vessel Enterprise.   Please...    (looks to Troi; she     nods)   ... please do us the honor of   visiting our vessel.
Nothing concealed, sir.
I am Lutan.
Captain Jean-Luc Picard. Welcome   aboard. These are my officers.   Second in command, Commander   William Riker; Ship's Counselor   Deanna Troi; my security officer,   Lieutenant Tasha Yar.
A woman? Your Chief of Security?
Yes, Lutan: that is her expertise.
I am honored to meet your   officers.       And this is my Secondary, Hagon.       A sample of the vaccine.
My duty, Lutan.
Sorry, I am required to inspect...
Aside, little one...
This... this is a woman?
How interesting!       May we prove as surprising to you.
If I may suggest, sir...
No apology. In their view, it   would weaken us.
Nothing concealed, Captain.       Do you care to accept it?
Yes, yes, please do.
Unless you care to examine it   further.
Absolutely not. This vaccine   sample is a gift of life and we   are honored at receiving it.    (indicates way into     vessel)   Will you do us the honor of   letting us entertain you now?
You may prepare it. We will join   you shortly.
I ask forgiveness....
They are strange alien things.   You bear no fault...
But the female...
May be exactly what I've needed.

Lutan, we're aware of many of your   planet's achievements, and its   unique similarity to an ancient   Earth culture, which we all   admire. On behalf of the   Federation, therefore, I am proud   to present to you this token of   gratitude and friendship. From   China's Sung Dynasty, Fourteenth   Century.
Thirteenth Century, sir.
Indeed?
(accepting and admiring     it)   It is a most thoughtful gift.   We are grateful.

We from Ligon have always been   apprehensive about strangers.   We are not as technologically   advanced as you; yet we possess   something you do not -- a vaccine   which has been found to be an   effective antidote to your deadly   Anchilles fever. If your conduct   toward us is worthy -- if you   respect our customs -- and if we   see this respect -- we will   become friends. Then, we will   make the vaccine available to all   who need it.
If you require respect from us,   I'm certain you will see it.
Surrounded by such friendship,   I have no need of my guards.       I will return shortly. Prepare   to transport me then.
If there is something else, any   final courtesy...
Is it possible to see one of your   wondrous holodecks? We have heard   how they are used to train your   officers.
And used for many other things   too.       Commander Riker, perhaps you and   Counselor Troi can demonstrate.
Is it possible for Lieutenant Yar   to do so Captain? Some   demonstration of defense training?
We've noticed you are intrigued   by her having security   responsibilities. But such things   are not at all unusual with us.
With us, it is the duty of women   only to own the land, and the duty   of men to protect and rule it.
Much the same has happened in   human history too.
I'd like to do it, sir.       As a sign of respect, perhaps.
Very well.
This way, please.
Aikido. One.
scene: 11   INT. HOLODECK - FULL SHOT - OPTICAL (SPLIT SCREEN)

quote: It won't move until my actions   activate it.
scene: 11   INT. HOLODECK - FULL SHOT - OPTICAL (SPLIT SCREEN)

quote: You can create people? Without   a soul?
scene: 11   INT. HOLODECK - FULL SHOT - OPTICAL (SPLIT SCREEN)

quote: It's not a real person, Lutan.   It has no life. Everything it   does is controlled by computer.
scene: 11   INT. HOLODECK - FULL SHOT - OPTICAL (SPLIT SCREEN)

quote: (continuing; to the     image)   Who am I? Do you hear me?
scene: 11   INT. HOLODECK - FULL SHOT - OPTICAL (SPLIT SCREEN)

quote: But it will feel real when it hits   you.
scene: 11   INT. HOLODECK - FULL SHOT - OPTICAL (SPLIT SCREEN)

quote: A force like that cannot possibly   come from an image, Lutan.
scene: 11   INT. HOLODECK - FULL SHOT - OPTICAL (SPLIT SCREEN)

quote: Then you will show me, Hagon.
scene: 11   INT. HOLODECK - FULL SHOT - OPTICAL (SPLIT SCREEN)
11   INT. HOLODECK - FULL SHOT - OPTICAL (SPLIT SCREEN)

quote: Thank you, Lieutenant. How very   enlightening.
scene: 11   INT. HOLODECK - FULL SHOT - OPTICAL (SPLIT SCREEN)

quote: Aikido, vanish.
scene: 11   INT. HOLODECK - FULL SHOT - OPTICAL (SPLIT SCREEN)

quote: I could create two -- even three,   but one is really enough. As you   fight with it, it learns, and   before long it knows exactly how   to defeat you.
scene: 11   INT. HOLODECK - FULL SHOT - OPTICAL (SPLIT SCREEN)

quote: Even the extraordinary Lieutenant   Yar?
scene: 11   INT. HOLODECK - FULL SHOT - OPTICAL (SPLIT SCREEN)

quote: It forces us to keep improving.
scene: 11   INT. HOLODECK - FULL SHOT - OPTICAL (SPLIT SCREEN)

quote: Your skill impresses me. I like   you.
scene: 11   INT. HOLODECK - FULL SHOT - OPTICAL (SPLIT SCREEN)

quote: Farewell, my new friends of the   noble Enterprise.
Understanding has made friends   of many different people. We've   had a good beginning, Lutan.
May I also extend a personal   farewell to Lieutenant Yar?
In your Federation terms.
Picard to bridge. Red alert!
Shields up; activate photon   torpedoes!
What com contact have we had with   them?
With their orbital control   station, sir.
Make contact there and on all   hailing frequencies.       Enterprise to Lutan and Ligonian   government. You have committed   an unfriendly act. You will reply   immediately.
Photon torpedoes ready, Captain.
Set for a display blast, a   thousand meters short of planet   surface. Fire!
Display blast away!
Do we know the source of their   transporter beam?
Our own transporter people tried   to trace it, sir, but without   effect.

It reads similar to Starfleet's   early efforts but uses the   Heglenian shift to convert matter   and energy in different...    (stops; seeing Picard's     expression)   ... which is actually not   important at this time.

This is Captain Picard of the   Enterprise with a message to Lutan   whom I have so far acknowledged   as a friend. But you have now   committed what our laws regard   as an attack upon us, Lutan. And   having visited us here, Lutan,   you must certainly understand the   power of our vessel. We have so   far fired only a warning burst   at you. We insist you reply to   this message.
Opinion, Counselor. Will they   injure Tasha?
I believe not, sir. In fact, they   seem mainly curious. But in the   case of Lutan I did feel other   needs.
What kind of needs?
Some sexual attraction from all   the males. Lieutenant Yar is   physically very attractive. But   I felt something else in the case   of Lutan... something more like...   avarice or ambition.
Other comments?
If I may, sir... one of the things   about them in the briefing studies   was their respect for patience.
Strongly emphasized. And you can   see it in the precise, ritualistic   way they do things. I'm worried   about Lieutenant Yar too, sir,   but maybe we should sit and wait   them out.
Analysis, the two of you.   Everything we know about them and   how these happenings fit into   that.
Stardate 41235.32. I am   concerned. Over a full day of   waiting with no response from...
... Lutan. We are now testing   whether they are aware of our   sensors probing them. So far,   we believe we have pinpointed   Lutan's government compound.
The vaccine, sir...
Yes, Doctor?
The vaccine...       I'm a... physician; I've seen death.   But not on the scale this could   mean.
Meanwhile, you were testing   whether we can replicate the   vaccine...

And we can't! Their sample   works fine when used as an   injection, but it becomes unstable   when we try to replicate it. You   must get vaccine from the planet,   Captain. As much as you can.   Immediately!
I'm aware of that, Doctor.
You've never had to watch a   patient die from this disease.
That's true. But I've seen my   share of death.
Damn!    (weak smile; shakes her     head)   Where are the calluses we doctors   are supposed to grow over our   feelings?
Perhaps the good ones never get   them.
Yes, Doctor?
May I speak about my son Wesley?
What?       Well, yes. Yes, of course.
He's so interested in starship   operations. And...       ... speaking as a mother, of   course, he seems quite   knowledgeable.
Well, yes... speaking as a   mother...
(indicates;     interrupting)   He's on the turbolift. You'll   remember you ordered him to stay   off the bridge.
I haven't stepped one foot on your   bridge, Captain...
It's all right, sir, I'll see he   leaves immediately...
No.
No?
Why don't you sit at Ops? Next   to Lieutenant La Forge.
Sir?
Sir?
Is the whole ship deaf?!       Sit down over there, young man!       Temporarily.
Captain, we have more information   from the briefing studies on   Ligon...
Excuse me.       Doctor Crusher, some of this may   interest you.
Proceed with your analysis.

It is a highly structured society   in which people live by strict   codes of honor. For example, what   Lutan has done is similar to what   certain American Indians once did,   called "counting coup." That's   from an obscure language called   French --
A language which for centuries   on Earth represented civilization,   Mister Data.
Indeed?
I suggest you drop it, Mister   Data.
Yes sir. Counting coup could be   as simple as touching an enemy   with a stick in battle, or taking   something from him and escaping.   It was considered extremely   heroic.
And under these circumstances   Lutan considers himself heroic,   risking literally everything in   the face of our superior power.
And it fits Lutan's personality   profile as well. He has an   abnormally high need for   achievement -- I've sensed it in   him, very strongly.

We should establish clearly also,   that Lutan is dangerous. Self   image for him is a function of   how much he THINKS he's achieved.   Those who set their standards too   high can kill to meet them.
Why Tasha?
As a Starfleet security officer,   she may have represented his   riskiest prize.
Transmission from the planet   surface, sir... Main viewer on.
Yes, Lutan? What do you wish?
You will display your image,   please.
What is required is an image of   Lieutenant Yar, well and...
Are you making demands, Captain?
Sir...
According to the Ligon Code of   Honor, Lutan has done what he set   out to do -- achieve recognition   for being daring and bold.
We've studied this in some depth   now, sir. The proper thing for   you to do now is to ask to get   Tasha back.
Ask for her?
Politely, Captain.
And now, Lutan...       You have boldly taken the   lieutenant from us and I ask that   you... now please return her.
Then come visit us, Captain, and   we will return her to you.
First Officer to Transporter   Chief...
Forgive me but can you delay   calling him?
Please. We must discuss the away   party.
Am I included?
It concerns you directly, Captain.
Wesley. It's time we left.
Wesley... thanks for taking a turn   at the controls.
Yes sir.
Commander....
"Commander?" That's quite   formal...
So is this request, sir. We   believe it would be preferable   if the captain led this away   party.
Agreed, sir. Their customs   concerning guests make it much   preferable.
And I'm very much against it.   Lutan is clearly a liar, and   devious. Counselor Troi has   admitted she believes him capable   of killing. It is my duty to keep   the captain out of danger, sir.
Except that Ligonian custom makes   it clear that a visiting leader   becomes an honored guest.       Not us, not second in command...   him.
And the custom requires Lutan to   die rather than violate that.
Yes... it does sound reasonable   put that way.       I warn you, Captain... if you get   hurt, I'll put you on report!
Welcome to my Centerplace, Captain   Picard. Consider yourselves my   honored guests.

quote: Every hospitality will be accorded   you.

quote: This is my First One, Yareena.
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: Lutan is a fortunate man.

quote: You've met Counselor Troi.
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: Yes.       As on your vessel, you have only   to name whatever courtesy we can   provide.
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: Then, sir... the courtesy of   seeing Lieutenant Yar.
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: Lieutenant Yar will be returned   to you tonight at a banquet I have   arranged in your honor.
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: I would like to see her now.
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: (thinks; then, to a     sentry)   Bring Lieutenant Yar.       I find it odd, Captain, that a   man of your experience has such   difficulty in understanding   ordinary politeness.
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: Such as saying "please" when   abducting someone?
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: The expression "please" is used   only when requesting the person   back.
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: Yours is a different world.
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: With clear and simple ways deeply   rooted in our culture. If you   are willing to ask for Lieutenant   Yar's release tonight in front   of all, honor will be satisfied.
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: One can see the importance of   "honor" here.
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: Honor is everything.
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: There will be gifts for each of   you, to absolve the abduction.
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: Lieutenant, have you been treated   well?
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: Fine, Captain...    (indicates bandaged     guard; smiles)   ... but they're showing some signs   of wear.
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: There isn't any need to be   concerned, Captain. She's being   well cared for.
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: My ship's company and I are   certain of your gentle wisdom in   that.
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: I thought for a moment I heard   a threat implied.       But that would be foolishness.
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: Something to be carefully avoided   I agree.
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: The festivities for her return   to you are in preparation. Shall   we retire until then?
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: Until tonight, Lutan.
scene: 34   EXT. LUTAN'S CENTERPLACE ON LIGON - ESTABLISHING

quote: We present you gifts!

Lutan, you have granted us   hospitality and the safety of your   Centerplace. The gifts you give   us are rare and precious. We   thank you. In accordance with   the customs of your ancestors,   which I honor and respect, I am   here in peace to ask for the   return of Lieutenant Yar.

Well spoken. There are some among   my equals in this gathering who   were wary of my approaching the   Federation. I am proud to have   taken this first step towards a   treaty -- and proud we have   something of great value to offer   you -- a priceless life-giving   vaccine.       The abduction I have done   according to our custom, for all   to see.       Your conduct in this matter has   been beyond exemplary, Captain   Picard --       -- but now that the moment has   come, I find I cannot part with   her.
You speak of a code of honor...   but what you are now saying is   called under our customs... an   act of war.
No, no, Captain! You do not   understand.
Correct! I am now beyond   understanding!
This is not an act of war, but   of love. I want Lieutenant Yar   to become my First One.
I challenge your right of   supercedence!
No woman has challenged   supercedence for over two-hundred   years!
The right is mine -- and I will   have it!       Natasha Yar -- I challenge you!   A struggle to the death!
NO! The challenge is   unequivocally refused!
Then you shall have no treaty --   no vaccine -- and no Lieutenant   Yar!
Ship's log, First Officer Riker   reporting. We have been informed   of the challenge to Lieutenant   Yar...
... and are maintaining combat   readiness round-the-clock. We   are probing Lutan's compound   deeply with our sensors now, still   unnoticed.
scene: 40   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - FEATURING SCIENCE AND TACTICAL

quote: Captain. Deanna.
Did you have any idea, Lieutenant,   that Lutan would suddenly announce   he wanted you for his First One?   What do you know of this?
Nothing, sir.
But it was a thrill. Lutan is   such... such a basic male image   and having him say he wants you...
Yes, of course it made me feel   good...
Troi! I'm your friend and you   tricked me!
Only so you'll think about it   completely and clearly.
We're all being manipulated,   Lieutenant, and most of all   myself.
How simple all this would be   without the Prime Directive.
That thought has passed thorugh   my mind, Counselor.
What's this message from Starbase   Fourteen?
scene: 42   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: It's showing infection rates,   percentage illness increases...       The plague on Styris IV has   flared up out of control.
scene: 42   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Oh, no!
scene: 42   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: (studying his own     viewer)   They're estimating deaths in the   millions, sir.
scene: 42   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: Captain Picard, come in.
scene: 42   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ANGLE ON RIKER

quote: I know I could win. Not that I'd   take her life, of course, but I'd   be glad to embarrass her. The   idea of accusing me...
The plague?
If anything, worse than we heard.
Which means they desperately need   the vaccine, sir. And I know   I can win this challenge...
You do not have to prove anything   here, Lieutenant.
But the vaccine is important in   this case, sir... ?
Counselor, I would consider you   the last person to argue for   Lieutenant Yar to accept that   challenge.
Betazoid blood is also practical,   Captain.       The odds are very good she'd   defeat Lutan's wife easily and   you would win all the bargaining   points you need.
"The odds are... ?"
As you have pointed out yourself,   we are all at risk every day of   every mission.
I'll want some explanations from   Lutan.
But why not let him volunteer   them, Captain? His needs for   approval are immense. I'm sure   if you found something you liked   about him, he'd be anxious to   agree with it.
Yes, he would indeed. He's almost   crippled with needs, the poor   handsome dear.
I should tell you I do admire the   hospitality you offer here, Lutan.   A pity you began by abducting my   security officer.
I am in the grip of forces you   do not understand.
Some of it I do understand. She   is a rather lovely female...
You surprise me, Captain. What   do you know of needs and feelings?
Nothing.    (pretends to hesitate;     smiles)   Well, almost nothing in my   position of ship's captain.
Aha, I see.
But it puzzles me; if you feel that   way about Tasha, why have you   challenged her to a fight to the   death?
Not I, Yareena! I am merely a   spectator.
But you are also a man of great   importance and wealth.
Great importance, perhaps...
Aha, I see. Then you too   understand the proper value of   women?
We understand they are highly   pleasant things... but after all,   unimportant, except for the land   they own.
You're a truly clever person,   Lutan. You have nothing to lose   either way the challenge goes.
A code of honor, Captain, protects   one like a magic cloak.
I will order Lieutenant Yar to   fight.       And may your cloak bring you all   you deserve, Lutan.
Come in.
Why that razor, my friend? Why   not the one I adjusted into   perfect efficiency?
Shaving is a human art form, Data.   Technological perfection can shave   too close.
Puzzling. How can anything be   too efficient?
Tens of thousands of things. Maybe   hundreds.
We always go back to the human   equation.
Exactly. Have you kept working   on it?
Constantly, my friend.

Particularly human humor. For   example, a man goes to a store   to buy some kidneys. He says to   the shopkeeper, "I'd like a pound   of kiddillies, please." The   shopkeeper says to him, "You mean   kidneys, don't you?" The man   says, "I said kiddillies, diddle   I?"
It's too old. And you didn't tell   it very well.
... How do you know when   something's funny?
It's not explainable. You just   do.
Perhaps it is you, Geordi.   Includling the kiddillies, I've   learned six hundred sixty-two   jokes, and you haven't...
"Includling the kiddillies!" Now   that's funny.
It was not meant as a joke!   The tongue slipped!
Riker to Commander Data,   Lieutenant La Forge. Report to   the Transporter Room for away   party duty.
First officer to captain. Ready   with the away personnel.

quote: Transporter locked in, sir.

quote: Energize!
scene: 48   INT. WEAPONS ROOM ON LIGON - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: You've both seen the message about   the plague?
scene: 48   INT. WEAPONS ROOM ON LIGON - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: And how badly the vaccine is   needed. Yes sir.
scene: 48   INT. WEAPONS ROOM ON LIGON - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: We need to know as much as   possible about Ligonian arms and   armaments. Data, especially   important will be an analysis of   their combat capabilities.   Geordi, concentrate on their   cutting edges where applicable,   durability, composition,   weaknesses of material.
scene: 48   INT. WEAPONS ROOM ON LIGON - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Aye, sir.
scene: 48   INT. WEAPONS ROOM ON LIGON - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: From any particular point of view,   sir?
scene: 48   INT. WEAPONS ROOM ON LIGON - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: From the perspective of Lieutenant   Yar's using them in combat with   Lutan's wife.
scene: 48   INT. WEAPONS ROOM ON LIGON - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Are you...       You, you're serious, I can see   that.
scene: 48   INT. WEAPONS ROOM ON LIGON - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Most interesting.       Could this be human joke number   six hundred sixty-three?
scene: 48   INT. WEAPONS ROOM ON LIGON - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Negative, Data! It's a captain's   order!
scene: 48   INT. WEAPONS ROOM ON LIGON - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Which makes it important to   know...       ... which of these weapons are to   be used.
scene: 48   INT. WEAPONS ROOM ON LIGON - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: That fact isn't known until the   combat begins.
scene: 48   INT. WEAPONS ROOM ON LIGON - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: You're right, Data. It does sound   like a joke. With the power of   the Enterprise, we could overwhelm   this place easily. Take what we   want.
scene: 48   INT. WEAPONS ROOM ON LIGON - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: I may not understand human humor,   sir, but I am a Starfleet Academy   graduate.
scene: 48   INT. WEAPONS ROOM ON LIGON - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Which means, of course...
scene: 48   INT. WEAPONS ROOM ON LIGON - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: ... understanding the Prime   Directive, sir.
scene: 48   INT. WEAPONS ROOM ON LIGON - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Which is, unfortunately, what this   is about. By our standards, the   customs here and code of honor   are the same kind of pompous,   strutting charades that endangered   our own species a few centuries   ago. We evolved out of it because   no one else imposed their own...    (stops; shakes head     ruefully)   Sorry, that became a speech.
scene: 48   INT. WEAPONS ROOM ON LIGON - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: You're the captain, sir. You're   entitled...
scene: 48   INT. WEAPONS ROOM ON LIGON - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: I am not entitled to bore you with   what you already know. Carry on!
scene: 48   INT. WEAPONS ROOM ON LIGON - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Ship's log, Commander William   Riker reporting. Stardate   41235.4.
Continuing our appraisal of   Ligonian technology. The Captain   has made it clear...
... he wants Lieutenant Yar beamed   immediately to safety if her life   should become endangered... and   I fervently hope the rules of that   contest make it possible.
Riker to Transporter Room. Do you   have our people on the sensors yet?
Their general area, sir. Visual on   screen now.
As you see, we're still doing some   fine tuning.
I agreed to this meeting, but I   see no point to it. You have   accepted the challenge; there is   nothing further to say.
I think you should know that there   is no physical training anywhere   that matches Starfleet, especially   its security people.
And you should know that even   though these contests are rare,   we have a tradition of making   ourselves capable of them.
Yareena, my acceptance had nothing   to do with Lutan.
It has everything to do with   Lutan. Lutan wants you to be his   First One.
Impossible, Yareena. I am a career   Starfleet officer...
How could you not love him? Every   woman loves him!
Yareena, I fight for the   vaccine... That's the truth.
The truth is I will kill you if   I can. And believe me, I can.   There is nothing else to say.
In my world it's a greater honor   to refuse to ...
You are on our world!
Captain, I'm your counselor. You   brought me with you to Ligon to   be of help.
Then help me, please. What is   a way out of this?
With the vaccine?       None. Not under the rules we   believe in.
The weapons in that room are   surprisingly durable and   flexible... and deadly.
And light, as if they're made for   women to use.
Some of them still have traces   of blood -- and poison.
Poison?
Alkaloid base. Deadly.
But we found no indication it is   invariably used, sir. Or ever,   in contests like this.
A theory, Data. What would be   the best defense against weapons   like these?
Undiminished attack because of   the possibility of poison, sir.
What about those lengths of metal   in the yard outside?

Uncertain, sir. However, joined   together they would make a   rectangle or square enclosing one   hundred twenty-one square meters.   If put end-to-end vertically,   they would make a pole forty-four   meters high, or two of twenty-two   meters, or...
Thank you, Data.
You are welcome, sir.
She won't budge. She loves him   -- without reservation.       And she thinks I love him too.
Most interesting. Do you?
Of course I don't, Data! As Troi   pointed out to me, I'm attracted   to him but that is entirely   different.
How so?
I'll agree it is puzzling, Data,   but since it involves Tasha's very   intimate and personal...
It involves nothing I'm ashamed   of!       In fact, you may discover that   the very worst move of your life   was when you threw in with flesh   and blood humans.
But certainly the most   interesting.

Interesting? Data, I grew up on   a failed colony, completely   lawless, mad, where people took   what they wanted. This meant   males for the reason they're   bigger, stronger...       And that's why I chose Starfleet   security, I guess.
For reasons you should be very   proud of.

Those were my early interests...   strength, daring, dominant   males... and that's why Lutan   attracts me. To me, he's like   a Federation Olympic Games hero.   But do I want to become his   so-called "First One," marry him?   That would be nonsense!
Most interesting.
Ah! You feel that also!
And having laid all that out,   Lieut...       Tasha... we come to a most serious   question...
Riker to captain.
Go ahead. We're alone.
We're fine tuned enough to see   your hosts gathering in the open   area outside with a number of them   now headed for your location.

Thank you, Number One.       I was about to ask if considering   that background, your apprehension   by Lutan, all of that... do you   still feel ready to undergo this   challenge? Do you judge your   condition good?
I judge it excellent, sir.
Your weapons, Lieutenant Yar.   You may pick your size.
Don't touch the spines! They're   poisoned.
If you're not careful you could   kill yourself.
(looks at spines; shakes     head)   These I understand.
First Officer's log, supplemental.   Captain Picard, faced with a   critical need for a vaccine   produced on this planet...
... has permitted Lieutenant   Natasha Yar to engage in a fight   to the death. I have yet to   understand his reasoning or his   plan.
scene: 62   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ESTABLISHING, THEN PANNING RIKER

quote: Care to lend a hand?
scene: 62   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ESTABLISHING, THEN PANNING RIKER

quote: Yes sir!
scene: 62   INT. MAIN BRIDGE - ESTABLISHING, THEN PANNING RIKER

quote: Was I seen leaving?
They've got eyes only for the   program.
Captain Picard wanted no risk of   our communications being   overheard. You're to proceed now,   as he indicated.
Captain's orders here, too.
Does the Captain understand what   you and Geordi reported about   those weapons? They're razor   sharp, split-second lethal...
I am here to brief you on what he   plans.
Any last minute instructions, sir?
Stay alive. We'll hope to do the   rest.
I speak for Lutan. The rules are   known; let combat continue until   there is a victor. It will not   be interrupted.       Proceed.
Combatants, hold your positions!       Return the weapon!
Yareena! Careful!
Move!
We're too late; she's growing   cold.
Sorry that clashes with my   instructions...
On no, no...
Exactly what do you find unfair,   Lutan? They fought to the death;   you saw the final blow; you know   the effects of your poison...
scene: 83   INT. CENTERPLACE - EMPHASIZING PICARD AND LUTAN

quote: But what of your Lieutenant Yar?   She is to become my First One now.
scene: 83   INT. CENTERPLACE - EMPHASIZING PICARD AND LUTAN

quote: I certainly won't stop her -- if   she cares to claim that honor.
scene: 83   INT. CENTERPLACE - EMPHASIZING PICARD AND LUTAN

quote: But remember, you now have all   Yareena's lands and wealth, Lutan.
scene: 83   INT. CENTERPLACE - EMPHASIZING PICARD AND LUTAN

quote: (with a wry smile at     Hagon)   At least, all has not been lost.
scene: 83   INT. CENTERPLACE - EMPHASIZING PICARD AND LUTAN

quote: Picard here.
scene: 83   INT. CENTERPLACE - EMPHASIZING PICARD AND LUTAN

quote: Since you've fulfilled your   agreement, Captain, can we now   beam the vaccine aboard?
scene: 83   INT. CENTERPLACE - EMPHASIZING PICARD AND LUTAN

quote: Ah, yes... of course.
scene: 83   INT. CENTERPLACE - EMPHASIZING PICARD AND LUTAN

quote: No problem, Number One. Send down   someone from medical.
scene: 83   INT. CENTERPLACE - EMPHASIZING PICARD AND LUTAN

quote: And to complete our business here,   we are locked onto you.
scene: 83   INT. CENTERPLACE - EMPHASIZING PICARD AND LUTAN

quote: Five to beam up. Energize.
scene: 83   INT. CENTERPLACE - EMPHASIZING PICARD AND LUTAN

quote: First Officer's log, Stardate   41235.6. I am returning the conn   to Captain Picard...
... as we begin loading the vaccine   supply aboard. Shortly, we hope   to signal "mission complete."
Welcome back, Captain, and you're   wanted in the lounge.
This way, gentlemen.
She is not dead! There was no   death combat; you have violated   our agreement. There will be no   treaty, no vaccine... !
scene: 86   INT. LOUNGE - ANGLE ON SIDE OF DOORS

quote: The challenge was carried out.   She died, Lutan.
scene: 86   INT. LOUNGE - ANGLE ON SIDE OF DOORS

quote: There was no challenge! She is   alive.
scene: 86   INT. LOUNGE - ANGLE ON SIDE OF DOORS

quote: I am a physician and saw her die.   If you doubt this poison, why not   test it on yourself?
scene: 86   INT. LOUNGE - ANGLE ON SIDE OF DOORS

quote: Lutan, we can provide you with   the medical records to prove her   death and how Doctor Crusher   brought her back.
scene: 86   INT. LOUNGE - ANGLE ON SIDE OF DOORS

quote: And at the instant of death,   Lutan, a mating agreement   dissolves.
scene: 86   INT. LOUNGE - ANGLE ON SIDE OF DOORS

quote: But this is witchcraft, Yareena.   To discard a mate in that   manner...
scene: 86   INT. LOUNGE - ANGLE ON SIDE OF DOORS

quote: ... is less painful than the one   you selected for me.
scene: 86   INT. LOUNGE - ANGLE ON SIDE OF DOORS

quote: No, Yareena...
scene: 86   INT. LOUNGE - ANGLE ON SIDE OF DOORS

quote: Even as I battled, Hagon, I heard   you calling out for me.
scene: 86   INT. LOUNGE - ANGLE ON SIDE OF DOORS

quote: Be my First One, Yareena.
scene: 86   INT. LOUNGE - ANGLE ON SIDE OF DOORS

quote: All my land, all my goods, all   I have... is yours to rule.
scene: 86   INT. LOUNGE - ANGLE ON SIDE OF DOORS

quote: That's so beautiful.       And so sad for you. You've lost   everything.
scene: 86   INT. LOUNGE - ANGLE ON SIDE OF DOORS

quote: I have my honor.
scene: 86   INT. LOUNGE - ANGLE ON SIDE OF DOORS

quote: It's such a... a waste!

quote: Do you want him?

quote: Then I will have you as my Number   Two.       Take your place accordingly.
scene: 86   INT. LOUNGE - ANGLE ON SIDE OF DOORS

quote: As you see, Captain, you may excel   in technology... but not in   civilized behavior.
scene: 86   INT. LOUNGE - ANGLE ON SIDE OF DOORS

quote: What the... !       Ah yes, Wesley.
Wesley!       He'd been manning that station   for me. I forgot.
Well!       Thank you again for manning one   of our bridge stations. We'll   see you get another chance.
Yes sir!
What's the delay, Number One?   Why aren't we warping out of here?
Set course for Styris IV, Warp   three.
Course laid in for Styris IV, sir.
Engage!
